User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the StudioZen application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

name.description: The display name of the user.

schoolType.description: The user's type of school (e.g., high school, university).

learningStyle.description: The user's preferred learning style, used to tailor AI-generated content.

FocusSession.title: FocusSession
FocusSession.description: Represents a focus session using the Pomodoro timer.

id.description: Unique identifier for the FocusSession entity.

startTime.description: The start time of the focus session. (date-time format)

endTime.description: The end time of the focus session. (date-time format)

duration.description: The duration of the focus session in minutes.

interruptionCount.description: The number of times the user was interrupted during the focus session.

Chat.title: Chat
Chat.description: Represents a single chat conversation between a user and the AI.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Chat session.

userId.description: The ID of the user who owns this chat.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the chat was created.

title.description: A title for the chat, usually generated from the first user message.

ChatMessage.title: Chat Message
ChatMessage.description: Represents a single message within a chat.

chatId.description: The ID of the chat this message belongs to.

role.description: The role of the sender, either 'user' or 'model' (AI).

content.description: The text content of the message.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the message was created.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure secure and scalable data management for the StudioZen application, focusing on authorization independence and clear data ownership. User-specific data (FocusSessions, Chats, ChatMessages) is stored under path-based ownership (`/users/{userId}/...`), ensuring only the owning user can access their data. This structure avoids the need for complex security rules that require reading parent documents, thus enabling atomic operations. Chat and FocusSession entities will exist as a subcollection of user documents to ensure that the authenticated user has access to this information. ChatMessage entities are a subcollection of Chat to maintain conversational order. This approach achieves authorization independence by leveraging the inherent path-based ownership in Firestore, which simplifies security rules and enhances performance.
